newsitem.title: JAPAN: Asahi Breweries mulling future ties with Foster's.
newsitem.headline: Asahi Breweries mulling future ties with Foster's.

text.p: Asahi Breweries Ltd is considering its future relationship with Foster's Brewing Group Ltd of Australia, in which the Japanese beer maker currently has a 14 percent stake, Asahi president Yuzo Seto told Reuters in an interview.
He said in the interview on Tuesday that the two companies' future relationship would be a "completely new one", but did not elaborate further.
Asahi will soon make a decision on its relations with Foster's, Seto added.

Foster's earlier on Tuesday dismissed as speculation a report by an Australian daily which suggested a major share buy-back is imminent as part of an effort to move two major shareholders from the register.
The report said a buy-back could be announced as early as on Wednesday.
The Broken Hill Proprietary Co Ltd of Australia owns 37 percent of Foster's while Asahi has 14 percent.
